titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Jacob Giltner, Indictment
CWG1038

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Clay circuit court
The commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Jacob Giltner

The Grand Jury of Clay County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Jacob Giltner of the Crime of Murder, Committed as follows, viz; The said Jacob Giltner on the 24th day of November 1865 in the County afforesaid did feloniously and wilfully & with malice afforethought kill and murder William Clark by Shooting him with a gun and Pistol against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
Reubin Baker
Thos Merrll
John Peters
John H Gilbert
John Sperlock

A true copy -- attest
G W Price C Clk

The commonwealth
vs } Indictment
Jacob Giltner
A True Bill
J. G. Gilbert
foreman
Murder
